page.title: 02RAGDALE, LEICESTERSHIRE _ 1
page.content:
Ragdale is a small village or hamlet, situated in North-East Leicestershire. 8 miles to the west lies the town of Loughborough and 6 miles to the east is the market town of Melton Mowbray.
Ragdale _ or Rakedale or Wreakdale as it was called in past centuries _ derives its name from a break or valley in the vicinity, traversed by a shallow brook, which flows into the river Wreake at Hoby, some two miles south of Ragdale.
In the 1983 census Ragdale's population was estimated at 115. The Electoral Roll for 1985 has 86 names on it.
